intro: Adonis pseudoamurensis, commonly known as the Amur poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Far East. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features delicate, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Adonis pseudoamurensis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
